newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar prices fall on sluggish demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar prices fall on sluggish demand.

text.p: Indian sugar prices fell on Thursday on sluggish consumer demand and little retail inquiry, dealers said.
"Supplies were also thin and sentiment was quiet amid limited activity," one dealer said.

In ready delivery sugar, S-30 slid by upto five rupees to 1,370/1,396 rupees per quintal while M-30 fell by five at 1,390/1,446 rupees. Sugar mill delivery also fell by five at 1,310/1,320 rupees as outstation demand eased at mill level.
Overall sentiment remained subdued at the close on low physical offtake. -- Bombay Commodities +91-22-265 9000
